content.description:
Go up a slab start off the deck, then continue up the easy and aesthetic dihedral with a short traverse left to the anchors at the top.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.protection: Bolt at the slab, then gain the dihedral; good pro to 4 inches up the corner.
content.location:
This is right of

Sun Burn

, further to the right of the alcove. Past a little buttress and clean face, it's a dihedral with a slab start.

content.description:
Climb slightly left to right on good-sized edges past six bolts to anchor. Shares the same anchors with

Sun Burn

.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.protection: Six quickdraws. Two bolt anchor (kind of hard to see from ground).
content.location:
This is just right of

Solar Flare

.

content.description:
This is a fun climb that shares anchors with

Sun Tan

. If you're feeling lazy, climb

Sun Tan

and toprope the thing.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.location:
This is just to the right of

Sun Tan

.

content.description:
From

Hot Corona's

base, walk down & right to the end of the ledge. Make a couple moves up right onto a shelf. Further down this is a left-slanting ramp to a good bolt. Pass this bolt to another shelf. Traverse left under a big yucca. Go over bulge past a bad bolt to another shelf and a nice crack system with big holds and occasional pro. Head right onto ridge at the top of the crack system to big ledge and tree/boulder anchor at the top.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.protection: Medium hexes, small to medium wires, bolts.
content.location: It is on the obvious buttress/ridge at the far right end of E.A.

content.description:
Start on

Sunshine

and move immediately left above the bolt onto clean rock of the orange face with positive tips pockets, nice rails, and little edge cruxes to the anchor of aforementioned route.

Lower down off the slab, there is a difficult direct hard start of Solar Wind on the left, up a thin, but widening seam, to a clean, orange face of wild underclings gaining relatively easier ground of the orange face.

Further left, a TR off a perch goes left to good holds in shallow dihedral and then ... is blank with good holds over a bulge only feet away....

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.location: This is on the clean orange face just left of Sunshine with a blank slab for a start.

content.description:
Follow 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.protection: Quickdraws to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The first of the last three climbs in the Solarium.

content.description:
Climb the slab start of

Sunshine

and move right on sweet jugs across a rail to beautiful in-cuts and liebacks up blunt arÃªte. Go up this on even nicer edges to a good horizontal crack & easier lower-angled moves past a little tree ledge bulge; friction up slab below the top.

Eds. Per

KJS

: this is on private land.  All land to the right of the East Animas designated climbing trail is on private land.  Please respect their request to not climb here.  Thanks.
content.protection: Pro to 1", bolts, two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Use the

Sunshine

start, then traverse right and up.
